Narrative  Party was notified that contact was made and phone reset,  states a family member will be stopping to check in on her  tomorrow morning.  Narrative  I spoke with Mrs. Arick, and forwarded the message. Mrs.  Arick appeared clean and nourished. The house appeared in  ordex from looking in the windows. However, Mrs. Arick did  show signs of dementia and indicated she was not sure she  knew how to use a phone to call her husband. I could see the  phone was off the hook from looking through the glass front  door. I contacted dispatch to advise the husband of my  findings, and to find out if there was someone who could  look after / check-in on Mrs. Arick. Prior to clearing,I  checked on Mrs. Arick one more time, she was on the phone  and speaking with her husband.

Narrative  CP looking to speak to Ofc Sacco about some missing plants.  Narrative  Attempted call back. No voicemail set up.  Sacco spoke with Dave Wiles who stated that the flowers were  an un-maintained flower bed that the Housing Authority  allows, but if unkempt, they remove same. Wiles stated that  it was 5-6 weeks after she moved to her new apartment that  his crew began dismantling the flower bed as technically, it  was not. supposed to be there. Several residents approached  him asking if they could have the plants as he was  discarding same. Wiles agreed and allowed them to take the  piants. Wiles stated that 1-2 weeks after the removal of the  plants, she became angry about the situation. Not a police  matter, this should be taken up with the Housing Authority.  . Narrative  Spoke with Grace who stated management sent her an email  agreeing to help move her flowers to her new apartment. Her  plants are all gone now and believed to be at different  apartments throughout the property. Grace stated that David  from maintenance gave residence permission to take what they  wanted. She claims management has done nothing to protect  her or her property. I will attempt to make contact with  David on monday to get his side of the story.

Narrative  Party, very indignant because WFD did not answer their  business line, complained about neighbor (2 houses from  hers)burning some type of debris. CP was advised of WFD not  being a full time dept, therefore not always manned.  She was also advised it was a FW issue and he would be sent  out to investigate it. Party refused to give name, address,  phone# (info gathered from 911 and inhouse screens).  1512 hrs. CP called back stating she was going to call Craig  Pedercini to complain about the fire again. She was advised  the FW was on the scene. Again it was explained to her that  it is a FW issue,  not WFD.  Narrative  FW reports people sitting around campfire. They agreed to  put it out because of the direction of the wind (blowing  smoke into neighbor's yard).

She requested owner information and  vaccination status.  16:15 Spoke with dog owner Emily Cordner/employee at CCF who  stated her female dog "Bean" a border collie mix was  responsible for the bite and is up to date on her  vaccinations. She said her dog was last seen in 11/19 at  Greylock Animal Hospital.  Dr. Degrenier also notified and given info. Copy of call  left in LT's mailbox. S-4  ' Narrative  Confirmed rabies vaccine good until this fall as it was  given 11/19/17 for "Bean". 10 day issued.  - Narrative

original_call_reason_action: Phone - SUSPICIOUS ACTIVITY  LOG ENTRY REQUEST
narrative_text: Narrative:  RP states that on Wednesday June 24,  2020 at 8:52AM he  received an email from Carol Rand, a Payroll Specialist at  Williams College, informing him that an unemployment  insurance claim had been filed on his behalf. Approximately  two hours later, he responded by email, informing Ms. Rand  that the claim was fraudulent. He then filed a fraud report  with the Massachusetts Department of Unemployment Assistance  and received email confirmation of this. His personal data  was compromised in the large Equifax breach and this may  have allowed persons unknown to file the fraudulent claim.
